hook.text: Your body can show physical signs of arousal even when your mind is not interested. This is nonconcordance.

buildup.text: Studies show women's genital arousal matches their self-reported desire only about 10% of the time.

discovery.text: For men the concordance is higher, around 50%, but still far from a perfect match between body and mind.

twist.text: This matters legally and ethically. Physical arousal during assault does not mean consent was given.

climax.text: Understanding nonconcordance teaches that the body's reflexes and the mind's desires are separate systems.

punchline.text: Body and mind do not always agree. Both signals matter.

quiz.question: How often does women's physical arousal match their self-reported desire?
